TollhouseMaster.synopsis: Dialogue with the Toll collector.She will continuously, endlessly demand gold from the player. You can convince her to let you pass (hard persuade), or you will have to fight  (once you stop giving it gold, or once you run out of gold).
TollhouseMaster.how_to_trigger: Speak to Gerringothe, the Tollhouse Master near-112; 27; -87

AD_Face_Heartlessness.synopsis: The Visage of Heartlesness is standing near some shelves with goods and talks about taking stuff from other people.Speaks with the same voice as the shadow-cursed tollmaster, but with a distinct emotional inflection. Heartlessnesst, in this case.

Face_Regret.synopsis: The Visage of Regret is standing near a window that is looking at the harbor and regretting not leaving this town.

PAD_CormyrCrate.synopsis: AD is played after the player used a specific container with emblem of Cormyr.
PAD_CormyrCrate.how_to_trigger: SCL_Main_A -> Tollhouse -> Click on a container with emblem of Cormyr.

AD_TollhouseMaster.synopsis: Tollhouse, Tollhouse Collector as she's hanging around by herself.

AD_SafeSkeleton.synopsis: Player clicks on the skeleton that locked himself in the heavy safe in Tollhouse. This was am employee of Tollhouse and this way he hoped to wait out the fallout of Shadowcurse. But have died in that safe in dramatic way.
AD_SafeSkeleton.how_to_trigger: -83; 28; -66read the note on the wall (Need pass DC 18 perception check)Open the safe doorClick on Skeleton

Face_Cowardice.synopsis: The Visage of Cowardice is hiding in the secret lair, hoping that nobody will find it (or its loot.)
Face_Cowardice.how_to_trigger: When entering the tollhouse, turn left to find Obedience, past Obedience is a door, go outside via the door and Cowardice is hiding in the room outside.

AD_Face_Greed.synopsis: This Visage of Greed is standing in front of a room full of confiscated items, lusting after them.Speaks with the same voice as the shadow-cursed tollmaster, but with a distinct emotional inflectoin. Greed, in this case.

AD_Face_Obedience.synopsis: The Visage of Obedience is standing near the entrance as the player enters the Tollhouse.

PAD_DalelandsCrate.synopsis: AD is played after the player used a specific container with emblem of Dalelands.
PAD_DalelandsCrate.how_to_trigger: SCL_Main_A -> Tollhouse -> Click on a container with emblem of Dalelands.

Face_Guilt.synopsis: The Visage of Guilt, hovering in front of several skeletons (dead adventurers that found their end by the hands of the Tollhouse Collector).

PAD_TollmasterDead.synopsis: In Town in Act 2 we meet the Tollmaster that went crazy about gold
PAD_TollmasterDead.how_to_trigger: Load SCL_Main_Agoto -112; 28; -92Talk to tollmaster, attack, kill

AD_ConfiscatedItemsPlaque.synopsis: Plaque in the Tollhouse, outside a room full of confiscated items.

PAD_ThayCrate.synopsis: AD is played after the player used a specific container with emblem of Thay.
PAD_ThayCrate.how_to_trigger: SCL_Main_A -> Tollhouse -> Click on a container with emblem of Thay.

PAD_Entrance_1P.synopsis: VB that is played when you approach the Tollhouse in SCL

AD_Face_Regret.synopsis: The Visage of Regret is standing near a window that is looking at the harbor and regreting about not leaving this town.Speaks with the same voice as the shadow-cursed tollmaster, but with a distinct emotional inflectoin. Regret, in this case.

Face_Heartlessness.synopsis: The Visage of Heartlesness is standing near some shelves with goods that it took from people.
Face_Heartlessness.how_to_trigger: loadlevel SCL_Main_Ain recon: god onteleport S_TWN_Tollhouse_Face_HeartlessnessSpeak with Visage of Heartlessness

PAD_ConfiscatedItemPlaqueUsed.synopsis: You've just clicked on a plaque beside a door in the Tollhouse, which tells you that room is for confiscated items. The way into the room is blocked by vegetation/fallen masonry (don't be specific).
PAD_ConfiscatedItemPlaqueUsed.how_to_trigger: Click on plaque outside 'Confiscated Items' room in TWN Tollhouse. ( S_TWN_Tollhouse_ConfiscatedItemsPlaque )

AD_Face_Guilt.synopsis: The Visage of Guilt standing in front of several skeletons (dead adventurers that found their end by the hands of the Tollhouse Collector).Speaks with the same voice as the shadow-cursed tollmaster, but with a distinct emotional inflection. Guilt, in this case.

Face_Obedience.synopsis: The Visage of Obedience is standing near the entrance of the tollhouse. All Visages pretty much ignore the player, they are more like shadow reflections of some aspects of the Tollhouse Collector, you are basically seeing some thoughts/memories.
Face_Obedience.how_to_trigger: Once you enter tollhouse, approach the visage on your left.

PAD_BlockedDoor.synopsis: PAD, happens when you click on a door in the tollhouse that is blocked from the other side.
PAD_BlockedDoor.how_to_trigger: Debug Book - Go To Region - Act 2 - Town - Tollhouse - click on Door - S_TWN_Tollhouse_BlockedDoor - 7dd7ccb9-f9af-4891-be7f-1fc531395aa3 - (-114 22 -91)

Face_Greed.synopsis: This Visage of Greed is standing in front of a room full of items it confiscated that became inaccessible once the shadows and vines moved in and blocked the room off.

AD_SaveOpenedWithCombination.synopsis: Player clicks on the heavy safe door and unlocks it without lockpicking because player learned the secret sequence by reading the note with it
AD_SaveOpenedWithCombination.how_to_trigger: -83; 28; -66read the note on the wall (Need pass DC 18 perception check)Open the safe door

PAD_Entrance_2P.synopsis: VB that is played when you approach the Tollhouse in SCL.Version for 2 characters.
PAD_Entrance_2P.how_to_trigger: Approach the Tollhouse in SCL with 2 characters

AD_Face_Cowardice.synopsis: The Visage of Cowardice is hiding in the secret lair, hoping that nobody will find it. Speaks with the same voice as the shadow-cursed tollmaster, but with a distinct emotional inflectoin. Cowardice, in this case.

automatic_ordering.reasoning: After reviewing the session definitions we see several clusters of related sessions. First, there are multiple sessions that show similar 'aspects' of the Tollhouse Collector’s personality (such as Regret, Cowardice, Greed, Obedience, Guilt, and Heartlessness) that appear in two forms – one without an AD_ prefix and one with it. It seems these are alternate treatments of the same 'visage' that would not appear together in the same playthrough. Similarly, there are two PAD sessions for the Tollhouse Entrance (1P versus 2P) that are alternative versions based on the number of characters in the party, so they cannot coexist. In another case, the safe area offers two mutually exclusive outcomes: either the player opens the safe door with the secret combination (triggering AD_SaveOpenedWithCombination) or the player clicks on the skeleton inside the safe (triggering AD_SafeSkeleton). Finally, the Tollhouse collector is first met in the TollhouseMaster dialogue. At a later point in Act II, if the Toll Collector has gone mad or been killed by the player, PAD_TollmasterDead is triggered. Thus, TollhouseMaster must come before PAD_TollmasterDead. Other crate-based PAD sessions (PAD_CormyrCrate, PAD_DalelandsCrate, PAD_ThayCrate) and the many combat AD sessions do not show explicit cause–effect ordering and are treated as independent triggers.

AD_TollhouseMaster_Buff_001_Combat_0.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
AD_TollhouseMaster_Buff_001_Combat_0.text: IF YOU WILL NOT GIVE, THEN I WILL TAKE!

TollhouseMaster_55.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
TollhouseMaster_55.context: CinematicNodeContext: Spotting you, Gerringothe lurches forward.NodeContext: a desperate, cacophonous howl

TollhouseMaster_161.speaker: Player
TollhouseMaster_161.text: I will bring an end to the curse that shrouds this land.

TollhouseMaster_69.speaker: Player
TollhouseMaster_69.text: Ballads, sonnets, jigs - the list is endless, really.

TollhouseMaster_42.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
TollhouseMaster_42.context: CinematicNodeContext: The creature is heaving, undulous with desire for gold.NodeContext: Roared with a shudder of pleasure on 'GOLD'.

TollhouseMaster_73.speaker: Player
TollhouseMaster_73.text: It seems to me you have enough.

TollhouseMaster_17.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
TollhouseMaster_17.text: NO - NO NO. YOU MUST PAY.
TollhouseMaster_17.context: NodeContext: Desperate to convince you it needs gold.

TollhouseMaster_21.speaker: Player
TollhouseMaster_21.text: If I give you gold, what do I get in return?

TollhouseMaster_41.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
TollhouseMaster_41.text: YOU CAN PASS. BUT FIRST YOU MUST PAY.
TollhouseMaster_41.context: NodeContext: Frantic, desperate, almost like smeagol trying to plead its case

TollhouseMaster_113.speaker: Player
TollhouseMaster_113.text: Only a fool's easily parted with gold - what's in it for me?

TollhouseMaster_128.speaker: Player
TollhouseMaster_128.text: Toss the creature a gold piece.

TollhouseMaster_163.context: NodeContext: The player tosses a gold piece to the creature. Gerringothe absorbs the gold

TollhouseMaster_29.speaker: Player
TollhouseMaster_29.text: Toss the creature another gold piece.

TollhouseMaster_119.context: NodeContext: The player tosses a gold piece to the creature. Gerringothe absorbs the gold

TollhouseMaster_82.speaker: Player
TollhouseMaster_82.text: I don't hand out so much gold for so little in return.

TollhouseMaster_147.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
TollhouseMaster_147.text: YOU MAY PASS THE RIVER. BUT FIRST YOU MUST PAY.
TollhouseMaster_147.context: NodeContext: Frantic, desperate, almost like smeagol trying to plead its case

TollhouseMaster_67.speaker: Player
TollhouseMaster_67.text: Toss the creature a gold piece.

TollhouseMaster_170.speaker: Player
TollhouseMaster_170.text: Why stay in this rotted building? Take your gold and be free.

TollhouseMaster_34.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
TollhouseMaster_34.text: THE GOLD IS NOT FOR ME. THE GOLD IS FOR THE TOLL. I COLLECT THE TOLL. I COLLECT THE GOLD.

TollhouseMaster_1.speaker: Player
TollhouseMaster_1.text: Says who? Seems to me there's no one here to oversee you.

TollhouseMaster_78.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
TollhouseMaster_78.context: NodeContext: Slipping into confusion. Dialogue ends after this and the monster is lost in thought/ confused by what the player has said.

TollhouseMaster_30.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
TollhouseMaster_30.text: I DO NOT NEED AN OVERSEER. I COLLECT THE GOLD! YOU - YOU MUST PAY!
TollhouseMaster_30.context: NodeContext: Becoming enraged; attacks after this.

TollhouseMaster_106.speaker: Player
TollhouseMaster_106.text: Haven't you heard? The local authority has decreed the gold belongs to the toll collector - you.

TollhouseMaster_99.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
TollhouseMaster_99.context: NodeContext: Slipping into confusion. Dialogue ends after this and the monster is lost in thought/ confused by what the player has said.

TollhouseMaster_31.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
TollhouseMaster_31.text: LIAR. LIAR! THE GOLD IS FOR THE TOLL. YOU MUST PAY. PAY!
TollhouseMaster_31.context: NodeContext: Becoming enraged; attacks after this.

TollhouseMaster_162.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
TollhouseMaster_162.text: BUT... GOLD. GOLD. YOU... MUST PAY...
TollhouseMaster_162.context: NodeContext: Losing heart. Peaceful and demure after this.

TollhouseMaster_66.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
TollhouseMaster_66.text: NO! YOU MUST PAY. YOU MUST PAY THE GOLD!
TollhouseMaster_66.context: NodeContext: Absolutely enraged; attacks after this.

TollhouseMaster_140.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
TollhouseMaster_140.text: THE GOLD IS NOT FOR ME! NOR YOU! THE GOLD IS FOR THE TOLL! DON'T YOU SEE?! DON'T YOU SEE?!
TollhouseMaster_140.context: NodeContext: Working herself into a rage, will attack after this.

TollhouseMaster_96.speaker: Player
TollhouseMaster_96.text: The happiness gold grants is temporary at best. Do not let your need for gold trap you here.

TollhouseMaster_71.speaker: Player
TollhouseMaster_71.text: I know lust and avarice when I see it. You'll never be happy, no matter how much gold I give you.

TollhouseMaster_4.speaker: Player
TollhouseMaster_4.text: Your obsession with gold is hurting you. If you leave this place, maybe you can still be saved.

TollhouseMaster_121.speaker: Player
TollhouseMaster_121.text: You're an endless pit of avarice. I won't bow to your corrupt demands.

TollhouseMaster_68.speaker: Player
TollhouseMaster_68.text: Enough! You're an embodiment of the curse and its corruption. You get nothing from me.

TollhouseMaster_83.speaker: Player
TollhouseMaster_83.text: You're corrupt. I don't take kindly to such tactics.

TollhouseMaster_175.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
TollhouseMaster_175.text: CORRUPTION - NO! GOLD - I NEED GOLD!
TollhouseMaster_175.context: NodeContext: Affronted/ frantic - trying to explain

TollhouseMaster_26.speaker: Player
TollhouseMaster_26.text: Gold, indeed - not for the toll, but for yourself. Isn't that right?

TollhouseMaster_171.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
TollhouseMaster_171.text: NO! NO. FOR THE TOLL. YOU MUST PAY THE TOLL!
TollhouseMaster_171.context: NodeContext: Faltering slightly. Player has convinced her.

TollhouseMaster_168.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
TollhouseMaster_168.context: NodeContext: You've confused her. She is docile now

TollhouseMaster_14.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
TollhouseMaster_14.text: NO! NO! YOU MUST PAY - YOU MUST PAY THE TOLL!
TollhouseMaster_14.context: NodeContext: Affronted, furious, sure she can't be wrong.

TollhouseMaster_143.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
TollhouseMaster_143.context: NodeContext: She is deflated and defeated after the player has successfully convinced her she's in the wrong.

TollhouseMaster_74.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
TollhouseMaster_74.text: STAND DOWN? NO! YOU MUST PAY! YOU MUST PAY GOLD!
TollhouseMaster_74.context: NodeContext: Furious. Will attack after this.

TollhouseMaster_40.speaker: Player
TollhouseMaster_40.text: Requesting more than one toll per traveller is quite illegal, per the relevant statutes. What is your defence?

TollhouseMaster_20.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
TollhouseMaster_20.context: NodeContext: Roaring. Will attack after this.

TollhouseMaster_28.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
TollhouseMaster_28.text: NO! THE GOLD IS FOR THE TOLL. THE TOLL MUST BE PAID! YOU - YOU MUST PAY!

TollhouseMaster_15.speaker: Player
TollhouseMaster_15.text: I'm afraid I'm actually your replacement. You've been fired as toll collector - terribly sorry.

TollhouseMaster_146.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
TollhouseMaster_146.text: REPLACE... ME? NO... I REQUIRE GOLD!

TollhouseMaster_24.speaker: Player
TollhouseMaster_24.text: You've been promoted! You'll collect gold from a much better tollhouse.

TollhouseMaster_160.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
TollhouseMaster_160.text: GOLD. MORE GOLD? I REQUIRE GOLD.
TollhouseMaster_160.context: NodeContext: A bit matter of fact, as if we didn't know this about her, without being TOO comedic

TollhouseMaster_141.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
TollhouseMaster_141.text: NO! I COLLECT THE TOLL. MORE GOLD - NOW!
TollhouseMaster_141.context: NodeContext: Super aggro, will fight after this

TollhouseMaster_61.speaker: Player
TollhouseMaster_61.text: You've done a great job here. Really set the standard. But I'll take it from here.

TollhouseMaster_108.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
TollhouseMaster_108.context: NodeContext: questioning. defeated. Will be docile after this

TollhouseMaster_169.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
TollhouseMaster_169.text: YOU WILL TAKE NOTHING! YOU WILL PAY! GOLD! GOLD! GOLD!
TollhouseMaster_169.context: NodeContext: Super agro, will attack after this.

TollhouseMaster_145.speaker: Player
TollhouseMaster_145.text: You dare to question their decision? Leave this place at once!

TollhouseMaster_111.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
TollhouseMaster_111.context: NodeContext: questioning. defeated. Will be docile after this

TollhouseMaster_52.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
TollhouseMaster_52.text: I WILL NOT LEAVE. I CANNOT LEAVE. I REQUIRE GOLD!
TollhouseMaster_52.context: NodeContext: Super agro, will attack after this.

TollhouseMaster_35.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
TollhouseMaster_35.text: NO... NO! I REQUIRE GOLD. ME!

TollhouseMaster_49.speaker: Player
TollhouseMaster_49.text: I'm here to replace you as toll collector.

TollhouseMaster_63.speaker: Player
TollhouseMaster_63.text: Gold is such a limited desire. With the right help, you could become so much more.

TollhouseMaster_79.speaker: Player
TollhouseMaster_79.text: The 'toll collector' scam is old and uninspired. Give it a rest - figure out a new trick.

TollhouseMaster_98.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
TollhouseMaster_98.text: TRICK? NO... GOLD! I REQUIRE GOLD!

TollhouseMaster_122.speaker: Player
TollhouseMaster_122.text: Yes, a trick - you're a trickster! You don't deserve the gold!

TollhouseMaster_104.speaker: Player
TollhouseMaster_104.text: Look, I've run this scam myself - I know it's a trick. A basic one at that.

TollhouseMaster_123.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
TollhouseMaster_123.text: A TRICK... I TRICK? NO NO NO!

TollhouseMaster_178.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
TollhouseMaster_178.text: I DO NOT TRICK. I COLLECT THE TOLL! YOU WILL PAY!

TollhouseMaster_65.speaker: Player
TollhouseMaster_65.text: I require passage - or your throat will be cut.

TollhouseMaster_130.speaker: Player
TollhouseMaster_130.text: Toss the creature a gold piece.

TollhouseMaster_6.speaker: Player
TollhouseMaster_6.text: How much do you want, exactly?

TollhouseMaster_142.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
TollhouseMaster_142.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Toll Collector absorbs a large pile of gold, glows brighter, and look satisfied, as if after a hefty meal

TollhouseMaster_93.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
TollhouseMaster_93.context: CinematicNodeContext: The toll collector leans toward the player, getting her mask close to their face, and shouts at them, before stepping back, ready to attack

TollhouseMaster_60.speaker: Player
TollhouseMaster_60.text: I have no more money to give.

TollhouseMaster_95.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
TollhouseMaster_95.text: IF YOU CANNOT PAY, YOU CANNOT PASS. GOLD. GOLD. GOLD!
TollhouseMaster_95.context: NodeContext: Desperate, increasing frenzy leading to combat.

TollhouseMaster_165.speaker: Player
TollhouseMaster_165.text: You're a toll collector. Or you were, anyway.

TollhouseMaster_45.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
TollhouseMaster_45.text: I COLLECT THE GOLD. THE GOLD SO YOU MAY PASS.

TollhouseMaster_173.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
TollhouseMaster_173.text: ALL MUST PAY. ALL MUST PAY! GOLD. GOLD. GOLD!
TollhouseMaster_173.context: NodeContext: Desperate, increasing frenzy leading to combat.

TollhouseMaster_114.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
TollhouseMaster_114.text: YOU CANNOT LEAVE. YOU MUST PAY.

TollhouseMaster_46.speaker: Player
TollhouseMaster_46.text: Harmony and a greater understanding of this plane.

TollhouseMaster_39.speaker: Player
TollhouseMaster_39.text: Everything from mephits to burning infernos - it depends on the day, really.

TollhouseMaster_103.speaker: Player
TollhouseMaster_103.text: Magical expertise. I have a presentation on Weave dissonance, if you'd like?

TollhouseMaster_127.speaker: Player
TollhouseMaster_127.text: Greater balance to the natural and civilised world, I hope.

TollhouseMaster_91.speaker: Player
TollhouseMaster_91.text: Depends on the beast I'm hunting.

TollhouseMaster_76.speaker: Player
TollhouseMaster_76.text: I'm afraid I'm more of a taker than a bringer, if you catch my meaning.

TollhouseMaster_94.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
TollhouseMaster_94.text: YOU BROUGHT VIOLENCE. UNACCEPTABLE. BUT ALL CAN BE FORGIVEN. FOR THE RIGHT PRICE.
TollhouseMaster_94.context: NodeContext: howling with anger on first phrases - more reasonable on last two phrases, hoping to get some cash out of the situation

TollhouseMaster_112.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
TollhouseMaster_112.text: I COLLECT THE GOLD. THE GOLD SO YOU MAY PASS.

AD_Face_Heartlessness_0.speaker: Visage of Heartlessness
AD_Face_Heartlessness_0.text: At least it's worth more than their lives.

AD_Face_Heartlessness_2.speaker: Visage of Heartlessness
AD_Face_Heartlessness_2.text: Can't wait to sell this rubbish.

Face_Regret_0.speaker: Visage of Regret
Face_Regret_0.text: You should leave now. I should have left when I still could.

Face_Regret_1.speaker: Visage of Regret
Face_Regret_1.text: So many ships came, so many ships left. And I remained.

PAD_CormyrCrate_0.speaker: Player
PAD_CormyrCrate_0.text: Silks from Cormyr, it says. Empty, though.

AD_SafeSkeleton_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_SafeSkeleton_0.text: *A forgotten soul, trapped in a safe - but who put them there, and why?*

AD_SafeSkeleton_1.speaker: Narrator
AD_SafeSkeleton_1.text: *The skeletal remains of the hopeful survivor still waiting to be rescued, their desperate refuge now their everlasting tomb.*

Face_Cowardice_0.speaker: Visage of Cowardice
Face_Cowardice_0.text: Please understand - I couldn't fight. Couldn't risk losing all this.
Face_Cowardice_0.context: NodeContext: Frantic; trying to convince itself of its own lies

Face_Cowardice_1.speaker: Visage of Cowardice
Face_Cowardice_1.text: Sorry - I had to lock the doors. Had to keep things safe.
Face_Cowardice_1.context: NodeContext: Frantic; trying to convince itself of its own lies

AD_Face_Greed_2.speaker: Visage of Greed
AD_Face_Greed_2.text: I want it back. Want it back now.

AD_Face_Obedience_0.speaker: Visage of Obedience
AD_Face_Obedience_0.text: All goods are subject to inspection and taxation.

PAD_DalelandsCrate_0.speaker: Player
PAD_DalelandsCrate_0.text: Cheese from the Dalelands. Or what's left of it.

Face_Guilt_7.speaker: Visage of Guilt
Face_Guilt_7.text: They gave me what they had. Should I have let them leave?

Face_Guilt_28.speaker: Player
Face_Guilt_28.text: Yes. But I guess you didn't.

Face_Guilt_4.speaker: Visage of Guilt
Face_Guilt_4.text: No. I thought there might be more to take. Hidden inside.

Face_Guilt_24.speaker: Visage of Guilt
Face_Guilt_24.text: I opened them. Searched inside them.

Face_Guilt_25.speaker: Player
Face_Guilt_25.text: That sounds like it might have proved fatal.

Face_Guilt_23.speaker: Visage of Guilt
Face_Guilt_23.text: Yes. Many died - all for trying to pass. I took too much from them.

Face_Guilt_12.speaker: Player
Face_Guilt_12.text: Smart - the most precious things are often hidden deepest.

Face_Guilt_0.speaker: Visage of Guilt
Face_Guilt_0.text: I thought so too - but I found nothing. And regretted everything.

Face_Guilt_2.speaker: Player
Face_Guilt_2.text: Why would you do something like that?

Face_Guilt_22.speaker: Visage of Guilt
Face_Guilt_22.text: Some wouldn't pay their dues. Some couldn't.
Face_Guilt_22.context: NodeContext: Rising disgust with each sentence - but a twinge of malice with the last few words

Face_Guilt_14.speaker: Visage of Guilt
Face_Guilt_14.text: They paid a different price in the end.

Face_Guilt_1.speaker: Player
Face_Guilt_1.text: If you can tell right from wrong, maybe we can still fix this.

Face_Guilt_11.speaker: Visage of Guilt
Face_Guilt_11.text: Yes - yes yes. Help me. Make me pay.
Face_Guilt_11.context: InternalNodeContext: The visage is excited by the prospect of finally being freed of its guilt (by being killed)

Face_Guilt_3.speaker: Visage of Guilt
Face_Guilt_3.text: I can't, I can't. It's too late.

Face_Guilt_10.speaker: Player
Face_Guilt_10.text: Perhaps you'd feel less guilty if you paid for your crimes too.

Face_Guilt_16.speaker: Visage of Guilt
Face_Guilt_16.text: Yes, yes. I have gold. So much gold. Take it.

Face_Guilt_29.speaker: Visage of Guilt
Face_Guilt_29.text: Take it all, whatever the cost.

Face_Guilt_9.speaker: Visage of Guilt
Face_Guilt_9.text: My guilt is my payment. My debts, bottomless.

Face_Guilt_13.speaker: Player
Face_Guilt_13.text: People die all the time. Stop being dramatic, and get over it.

Face_Guilt_21.speaker: Player
Face_Guilt_21.text: No - there's always more to take.

Face_Guilt_18.speaker: Visage of Guilt
Face_Guilt_18.text: That's what I thought. But I found nothing.

Face_Guilt_15.speaker: Visage of Guilt
Face_Guilt_15.text: They paid more than their share.

PAD_TollmasterDead_0.speaker: Player
PAD_TollmasterDead_0.text: Free from the curse, now - perhaps she'll find peace.

AD_TollhouseMaster_Buff_005_Combat_0.speaker: Gerringothe Thorm
AD_TollhouseMaster_Buff_005_Combat_0.text: NO MORE TAKING. GIVE. GIVE. GIVE!

PAD_ThayCrate_0.speaker: Player
PAD_ThayCrate_0.text: All the way from Thay. Jewels and gems, probably - one's still in there.

PAD_Entrance_1P_0.speaker: Player
PAD_Entrance_1P_0.text: Crates and caravans. Must be where tolls were collected.

AD_Face_Regret_1.speaker: Visage of Regret
AD_Face_Regret_1.text: If only I'd left when I still could.

AD_Face_Regret_2.speaker: Visage of Regret
AD_Face_Regret_2.text: The horizon seemed so close. But that was long ago.

AD_Face_Regret_3.speaker: Visage of Regret
AD_Face_Regret_3.text: I was meant for better things.

Face_Heartlessness_0.speaker: Visage of Heartlessness
Face_Heartlessness_0.text: You'll find much of sentimental value among the confiscated goods. That is to say - junk.
Face_Heartlessness_0.context: InternalNodeContext: The visage is disgusted at how little people had. Full poverty-shaming (because it wanted more.)

Face_Heartlessness_1.speaker: Visage of Heartlessness
Face_Heartlessness_1.text: People treasure the most insignificant things - pets, children, memories.
Face_Heartlessness_1.context: InternalNodeContext: Disparaging of how much ordinary people valued all their earthly goods. As far as it's concerned, this is all trash.

PAD_ConfiscatedItemPlaqueUsed_0.speaker: Player
PAD_ConfiscatedItemPlaqueUsed_0.text: Well, we're not getting in this way.

AD_Face_Guilt_0.speaker: Visage of Guilt
AD_Face_Guilt_0.text: Nothing left to take. Nobody left to kill.

AD_Face_Guilt_1.speaker: Visage of Guilt
AD_Face_Guilt_1.text: It was me. It was all me.

AD_Face_Guilt_3.speaker: Visage of Guilt
AD_Face_Guilt_3.text: I did it. Over and over, I did it.

Face_Obedience_0.speaker: Visage of Obedience
Face_Obedience_0.text: Report to the tollmaster. Pay the toll.

PAD_BlockedDoor_0.speaker: Player
PAD_BlockedDoor_0.text: Forget it - it's blocked from behind.

Face_Greed_0.speaker: Visage of Greed
Face_Greed_0.text: Leave it. LEAVE IT. It's MINE.

Face_Greed_1.speaker: Visage of Greed
Face_Greed_1.text: Look at it. Look at it all. Mine, MINE.

AD_SaveOpenedWithCombination_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_SaveOpenedWithCombination_0.text: *The heavy door grinds open. The combination worked.*

PAD_Entrance_2P_0.speaker: Player
PAD_Entrance_2P_0.text: Crates and caravans. The town tollhouse, surely.

PAD_Entrance_2P_1.speaker: Player
PAD_Entrance_2P_1.text: Surprisingly spacious. Must have been quite active in its heyday.

AD_Face_Cowardice_1.speaker: Visage of Cowardice
AD_Face_Cowardice_1.text: I won't go. I won't let them take me.

AD_Face_Cowardice_2.speaker: Visage of Cowardice
AD_Face_Cowardice_2.text: Anyone would have done the same.

AD_Face_Cowardice_3.speaker: Visage of Cowardice
AD_Face_Cowardice_3.text: They can't find out. They can't know.
